content: पिंड {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (डी|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [पिंड्-अच्] {@--1@} Solid (घन). {@--2@} Compact, dense, close. --डः --डं {@--1@} A round mass, ball, globe; as in अयःपिंडः नेत्रपिंडः &c. {@--2@} A lump, clod (of earth &c.). {@--3@} A round lump of food, morsel, mouthful; <ls>R. 2. 59.</ls> {@--4@} A ball or lump of rice offered to the Manes at obsequial ceremonies or Śrāddhas; <ls>R. 1. 66</ls>; <ls n="R.">8. 26</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 216</ls>; <ls n="Ms. 3."></ls> <ls n="Ms.">9. 132</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 9.">136</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 9.">140</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 159.</ls> {@--5@} Food in general; सफलीकृतभर्तृपिंडः <ls>M. 5</ls> ‘who was true to his master's salt’. {@--6@} Livelihood, sustenance, subsistence; <ls>Mu. 3. 14.</ls> {@--7@} Alms; पिंडपातवेला <ls>Māl. 2.</ls> {@--8@} Flesh, meat. {@--9@} The fœtus or embryo in an early stage of gestation. {@--10@} The body, corporeal frame; एकांतविध्वंसिषु मद्विधानां पिंडेष्वनास्था खलु भौतिकेषु <ls>R. 2. 57.</ls> {@--11@} A heap, collection, multitude. {@--12@} The calf of the leg; <ls>Māl. 5. 16.</ls> {@--13@} A round button {@--14@} Anything round, thick, gross or solid. {@--15@} An object in general. {@--16@} A particular part of a house. {@--17@} (In <ab>astr.</ab>) A sine expressed in numbers. {@--18@} The twenty fourth part of the quadrant of a circle. {@--19@} The frontal sinus of an elephant or its projection. {@--20@} A portico or shed in front of the door. {@--21@} Incense. frankincense. {@--22@} (In arith.) Sum, total, amount. {@--23@} (In geom.) Thickness. --डं {@--1@} Power, strength, might. {@--2@} Iron. {@--3@} Fresh butter. {@--4@} An army.
